name: Queries for Number of Palindromes
description:
You've got a string s = s1s2... s|s| of length |s|, consisting of lowercase
English letters. There also are q queries, each query is described by two
integers li, ri (1 ≤ li ≤ ri ≤ |s|). The answer to the query is the number of
substrings of string s[li... ri], which are palindromes. String s[l... r] =
slsl + 1... sr (1 ≤ l ≤ r ≤ |s|) is a substring of string s = s1s2... s|s|.
String t is called a palindrome, if it reads the same from left to right and
from right to left. Formally, if t = t1t2... t|t| = t|t|t|t| - 1... t1. Input
The first line contains string s (1 ≤ |s| ≤ 5000). The second line contains a
single integer q (1 ≤ q ≤ 10^6) — the number of queries. Next q lines contain
the queries. The i-th of these lines contains two space-separated integers li,
ri (1 ≤ li ≤ ri ≤ |s|) — the description of the i-th query. It is guaranteed
that the given string consists only of lowercase English letters. Output Print
q integers — the answers to the queries. Print the answers in the order, in
which the queries are given in the input. Separate the printed numbers by
whitespaces. Examples Input caaaba 5 1 1 1 4 2 3 4 6 4 5 Output 1 7 3 4 2 Note
Consider the fourth query in the first test case. String s[4... 6] = «aba».
Its palindrome substrings are: «a», «b», «a», «aba».
